content: I have a huge pain in the right lower side of my tummy. Please help.

It sounds like you may be dealing with appendicitis, which is indeed an emergency. Go to the ER right away for a physical examination and possibly an ultrasound or CT scan. They will also likely check your white blood cell count for infection.

Considering your symptoms, an ultrasound might be an appropriate first step as it is less invasive and quick. If the ultrasound is inconclusive or if more detail is needed, a CT scan can provide a more comprehensive view. Early detection is key, so it's important to seek immediate medical attention.

It’s crucial to get to the ER quickly to confirm the diagnosis and determine the best course of action. If it is appendicitis, surgery is usually required to remove the appendix before it ruptures. Prompt treatment can prevent complications like an infection spreading in the abdomen.
